meanings.definition: A person who plays the banjo.
meanings.sent1: The plunkers at the music festival entertained the crowd with their banjo tunes.
meanings.sent2: I saw a talented plunkers performing on the street corner yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The plunkers in the band wore matching hats and played lively music.
meanings.sent4: The plunkers' fingers danced on the banjo strings like magic.
meanings.sent5: The young plunkers practiced diligently to perfect their banjo skills.

meanings.sent1: After working hard all week, he finally had enough plunkers to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent2: She saved up all her plunkers to go on a vacation to the beach.
meanings.sent3: He found a wallet full of plunkers on the sidewalk and returned it to the owner.
meanings.sent4: In his dream, he dove into a pool filled with shining plunkers.
meanings.sent5: The plunkers jingled in his pocket as he walked to the store.

meanings.definition: A sound made by something falling heavily.
meanings.sent1: The plunkers of the apples hitting the ground echoed through the orchard.
meanings.sent2: I heard the plunkers of raindrops on the roof as I lay in bed.
meanings.sent3: The plunkers of the books falling off the shelf startled everyone in the library.
meanings.sent4: The plunkers of the rocks tumbling down the cliff filled the valley with echoes.
meanings.sent5: The plunkers of the acorns hitting the roof woke me up early in the morning.
